selected_quotes: Use of oral corticosteroids for 30 days tied to risk for sepsis, fracture, and venous thromboembolism
Our top story of the week: Using oral corticosteroids for 30 days tied to sepsis, fracture, VTE
Stroids can lead to VTE. Even short courses!
Proud to share an office with
My new medical philosophy: no one gets anything anymore. Ever.

facebook.summary: Use of oral corticosteroids for less than 30 days is associated with increased risks for sepsis, venous thromboembolism, and fracture, according to an observational study in The BMJ: http://jwat.ch/2oF0ksa

facebook.summary: Prednisone may help you feel better right away, but even short courses can have serious consequences. In most cases there are natural alternatives!

facebook.title: Short-Term Use of Oral Corticosteroids Tied to Sepsis, VTE, and Fracture
facebook.summary: Think twice about asking for steroids for every little cold or sore throat, or anything for that matter.   They may increase your risk for sepsis (that is, overwhelming infection), blood clots, and fractures.
